computer.description: The information we have about this computer is sketchy. O.S. was a powerful graphical BASIC interpreter modded from the TI basic. Forth language was also available but not widely used. Cortex had a mode to give 256 K RAM. ROM was copied into RAM at start-up and then swiched off allowing boot code and basic to be altered at start-up. Cortex was followed by the Cortex II which was just a re cased version with same style as early apple/dragon 32 beige/yellow plastic sloping cases, but using same main board and disk drives.
computer.media: Optional 5.25'' FDD (worked off a TMS9909 FDC. The Basic included a 'Boot' command which would boot the disk.)
computer.name: CORTEX
computer.ports: Serial RS-232C, Tape recorder port, optional Parallel printer card made by the Cortex User Group, Ebus extension bus that would take cards from the TI990 series minicomputer.
computer.price: £249 + vat (later £199 + vat) for a kit of self assemby parts. Construction details in 'Electronics today international' magazine
computer.sound: built in speaker with primitive sound function
